## getIn() function

Allows to get a value deeply in an object without throwing an exception if the path does not exist.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function getIn(obj: any, key: string, defaultValue?: any): any;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  obj | <code>any</code> | Object to retrieve the value. |
|  key | <code>string</code> | Path of the value. |
|  defaultValue | <code>any</code> | Default value to return if the value is not found. |

<b>Returns:</b>

`any`

Value if found, default value or `undefined` otherwise.

## Example


```js
const obj = {
  key: {
    values: [1, 2, 3]
  }
}

// Returns 2
getIn(obj, 'key.values[1]');

// Returns undefined
getIn(obj, 'key.values[100]');

// Returns -1
getIn(obj, 'key.values[100]', -1);

```
